Case Study

FlySTL

Lambert Airport’s public site hadn’t kept pace with traveler expectations: flight status, TSA, parking, and concessions data lived in disconnected systems, navigation was confusing, and the previous theme couldn’t meet the stricter accessibility and multilingual requirements.

Visit live site

Challenge

What they needed

Lambert Airport’s public site hadn’t kept pace with traveler expectations: flight status, TSA, parking, and concessions data lived in disconnected systems, navigation was confusing, and the previous theme couldn’t meet the stricter accessibility and multilingual requirements.

Approach

How we solved it

Dual agency project with Kestrel and Dovetail. Led the rebuild on a custom Tailwind/_tw WordPress theme, wiring Kadence + ACF blocks for every layout need and hooking Alpine.js components into multiple APIs. Built flight-status and search blocks that hydrate from the airport data feed, cron-driven TSA wait-time + open-lane widgets that cache JSON locally, and parking availability cards that hit SuperParkingLot in real time. Hardened the navigation with accessible mega menus, header tab panels, Kadence off-canvas controls, ReciteMe + Google Translate helpers, and skip-link/keyboard workflows. Imported legacy shop/dine + art content via WP All Import + ACF, added custom tax queries, Gravity Forms, and FacetWP filters so the airport team could manage everything without editors calling an engineer.

Completed

November 2025

Website

https://www.flystl.com/

Stack highlights

  • WordPress
  • Tailwind CSS
  • Advanced Custom Fields
  • Kadence
  • Alpine.js
  • REST API
  • PHP
  • Gravity Forms
  • wpallimport
  • Accessibility
